thread.title: 2024 - Ukraine: “Putin has no limit, France will have no limit in its support” in kyiv, assures Sylvain Maillard
thread.title_full: 2024 - Ukraine: “Putin has no limit, France will have no limit in its support” in kyiv, assures Sylvain Maillard

author: @aliihsan
title: 2024 - Ukraine: “Putin has no limit, France will have no limit in its support” in kyiv, assures Sylvain Maillard
text:
Yanis Darras
08:59, March 8, 2024 modified to
9:12 a.m., March 8, 2024
Sylvain Maillard, president of the Renaissance group in the National Assembly and deputy for Paris, was the guest of the Grande Interview Europe 1-CNews. At the microphone of Romain Desarbres, he returned to the Ukrainian conflict and assured that “France will have no limit in its support for Ukraine”.
The war does not end in Ukraine. Two years after the start of the Russian invasion of Ukrainian territory, the conflict has become bogged down. Both armies are struggling to advance, while aid to kyiv remains more fragile than ever. Guest on the set of La Grande interview Europe 1-CNews, the president of the Renaissance group in the National Assembly and member of parliament for Paris, Sylvain Maillard, does not hide France’s determination to continue its support for the Ukrainian state.
“Putin has no limits in his attacks. France will have no limits in its support for Ukraine. It is very clear. The President of the Republic has said so,” he insists. at the microphone of Romain Desarbres. An echo of the head of state’s declaration last week, no longer excluding the idea of ​​sending Western troops to the Ukrainian front. Comments which were not unanimous within the European Union, nor among the Americans.
Putin, a “man of war” “Putin spoke a few days ago in what we call a speech to the union and said one thing. You have to understand that Putin is saying exactly what he is doing. And he is saying that the Empire Russia needs war. (…) He says it and therefore, we must show him the limits and we must be very firm on them. Vladimir Putin is a man of war and we will be there, Europe will be there, to tell him to stop,” assures the Parisian MP.
“We must not hide it: the situation is extremely serious, extremely serious” in Ukraine, he continues. “Our fellow citizens know it. We must not have a hand that shakes. And Emmanuel Macron just said what we will do. Vladimir Putin says what he does. We say what we will do. We will continue to support without limit ‘Ukraine’ he concludes.
Source link -74
